name: tablemount
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a mountain under the sea with a flat top: Tablemounts are flat-topped volcanic cones that lie 3,000–6,000 feet below sea level and rise 9,000–15,000 feet above the ocean floor. Synonym
guyotCompare
seamount
More examplesFewer examplesMost of the 2,000 known tablemounts are concentrated in the western Pacific.I ran across this tablemount off the coast of southern California.The north-south line of tablemounts in the northwestern Pacific are in the Emperor Seamounts, also an entirely submerged range.Reed Bank, a tablemount near the Philippine coast, is rich in untapped oil and gas deposits.
